quotes: We really don't have a process for enabling people to update their data.
I have this love-hate relationship with wild apricot.
I think that we as a club need to present ourselves as being fresher and more contemporary.
I feel very, very lucky when I find that button to join.
I really want a my newcomers page that just lists in one place all of the events I'm registered for.
I want to second your comments about not being able to update our information.

inferences: Ed likely feels frustrated with the outdated technology and the lack of user-friendly features on the website.
He may be concerned about how the club is perceived by new and potential members.
Jamie, as a new member, might be relieved to have found a welcoming community but could also feel overwhelmed by the technology.
Todd seems to have pride in the legacy of his family involvement but may worry about how to remain engaged in the community.

observations: Ed actively navigates and tests the membership join workflow, indicating his hands-on approach to understanding the system.
Jamie jumps into the calendar to see events, showing her eagerness to participate despite finding it clunky.
Todd shares tips with other new members, demonstrating a willingness to help others and share his positive experience.
Pam expresses the need for more weekend events, highlighting her current engagement with the community.

emotions: Ed expresses a sense of frustration and disappointment with the current system, which impacts his pride in the club.
Jamie feels lucky and honored to be part of the community, but also experiences anxiety about fitting in and utilizing the technology.
Todd feels a sense of nostalgia and pride in his family's history with the club, contributing to his overall positive experience.
Pam feels overwhelmed by the limitations in scheduling events, but also expresses a desire to contribute to improvements.
